children: Prescription opioids are a major cause of morbidity and mortality. The risk for overdose is increased with higher doses (>50 morphine mg equivalents/d) and concurrent benzodiazepine prescription.
Most patients with opioid use disorder will require psychosocial support and medication-assisted treatment (buprenorphine-naloxone, buprenorphine,
naltrexone). Intranasal naloxone is an important adjunctive therapy in opioid use disorder. Friends and family members may also receive prescriptions and training in naloxone use.
